data.title: Great tasting experience!
data.text: went to ABC while in port on a cruise...had a wonderful wine tasting experience with Emily...she handled us and another small group with ease and knowledge.  The wines are very good and come in a wide price range.

data.title: Bad Tasting Experience
data.text:
Ugh.  While I suppose it is convenient that this tasting room is in downtown Santa Barbara, it was not an enjoyable experience.  We headed in on a Friday afternoon.  The bar was occupied, so we were told to sit at the side table.  It was covered in boxes of wine and publications; we clear some space at the end.  While we were welcomed when we came in, after sitting down, it took a long time for the staff to acknowledge our presence and begin the tasting (this did not stop them from seeking gratuity at the end of the experience).  The tasting itself them took forever; our server was clearly more interested in a couple she knew at the bar.  When she finally did come to pour the next glass, she basically told us what it was and then walked away--little description as to what to expect and zero interest in what we thought.

Here's what we thought:  bad wine, at least compared to most of the other things we tried in the St. Inez Valley.  And, even if we'd like some well enough to buy it, we wouldn't have wanted to do business with this place, who showed about zero interest in us.

Some advice:  clean-up the tasting room, pay attention to your guests, train your staff.  Not that hard.

data.title: Very shady practices. Don't be fooled!
data.text: We went in after lunching at the restaurant nearby. There were two tasting menu selections, one basic, another, reserve that included the chardonnay that they promoted as having a high score at a higher price. We decided to take the latter. We did not really like 3 of the 5 samples; the chardonnay was good and a pinot was ok. We decided to buy 3 bottles of the chardonnay, which qualified us for complimentary tasting. I was handed a tablet to pay, with suggested tipping at 18%, 20%, 25% levels; I don't recall having an option to write in my own tip. At the time, it seemed the tablet made it easy in terms of calculation of the tip amount as many places have gone to. I was talking, and absent-mindly made a selection. It was only after we walked out and I thought about it that I realized the way they had set up the payment process, they made me tip on the carry-away purchase!! As a result, I tipped three times as much as the girl really deserved based on the tasting. I also felt there was perhaps intentional steering towards the more expensive tasting menu by only offering the chardonnay on the reserve version.They fooled us, but hopefully won't get the chance to fool others.

data.title: Limited varieties of red
data.text: Although their wines were very good,  the varieties were limited compared to others in the area which is what lead my rating, not the quality.  Overall pleasant experience.  The staff was helpful and pleasant. We did not have the auto-tip issue.  The iPad did go to a tip choice screen and perhaps the other reviewer had never seen that previously and hit a button by accident.  We truly enjoyed ourselves here.

data.title: Unethical 50% automatic Tipping charge for wine tasting
data.text: DO NOT GO IN THIS TASTING ROOM! This is outrageous and very unethical. We paid for a full flight wine tasting and had no problem doing that although all we wanted to taste was their Pinot noir wines. We also purchased one bottle of wine. We are from Canada so are very limited to what we can take home. The staff who waited on us entered the amount in her little machine and handed it over to my husband. He was talking and wasn't paying close enough attention to the amount. After we left we realized we were charged $9.48 tip for an $18.52 plus tax tasting fee. We've expressed our concern with Au Bon Climat but they have not responded to us, nor have they offered to refund this outrageous unethical tip. Shame on Au Bon Climat!

data.title: Great wines with many choices
data.text:
The wines from this producer are across the board consistently very good to excellent.  This tasting room is better than most in the they carry library wines as well as current releases.
One can taste though those being poured in the glass for a reasonable price and also shop for wines on the shelves that extend beyond what is poured at the counter.
They have a comfortable outside seating area that allows for more longer tasting pleasure.

data.title: Nice wine, quite environment, why the gratuity?
data.text:
Pleasant tasting room, fair wine pours, friendly approach, good wines.
Just cant understand when paying that a gratuity was automatically prompted by the card payment machine? It put me off a bit.

data.title: Classic wines
data.text: We made a side trip to Santa Barbara from Solvang to see the area and visit the Au Bob Climat tasting room. Au Bon Climat have classic and very nice Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, but the atmosphere seemed a bit sterile and businesslike - even early in the morning on a Thursday with no other visitors.  The wines are worth a repeat visit - the tasting room maybe less so.

data.title: Top Tasting Room
data.text:
Great people, great wines, absolutely delightful service.

Probably the best tasting room we have been to in our roadtrip in California.

Highly recommended.

Must Try : 2009 Pinot Noir Le Bon Climat 13.5% Clendenen Family

data.title: Really good Pinot without faults or pretense - mast visit
data.text: Always stop here. The best set of balanced wines with no pretense, just great length, acidity and understated elegance. Very informed staff and an unhurried up-scale tasting experience.

data.title: Best tasting in town
data.text: We spent a happy hour or so tasting delicious pinots and learning more about this winery. The host was charming and happy to talk wine and food, both locally and further north. We were grateful for the dinner and tasting room recommendations and just sad that as we were coming back to the UK we could only buy a couple of bottles to drink during our trip.  Definitely worth visiting.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Good wine and a friendly and knowledgeable young man behind the bar.  We were there on a Monday, so the tasting was nice and leisurely.

data.title: nice wines with a convenient downtown location
data.text: Nice wines from a well known wine maker.  This was our last stop of the day on the way back to our Inn.  convenient downtown location.  very good wines.

data.title: Pinot Noir Heaven
data.text: I am a big fan of Pinot Noir, so chose this as a key tasting room to visit in the city of Santa Barbara.  Located just one block from the State Street shopping area, in a building with several other tasting rooms.  Two tasting options are available, one at $10 and one at $15.  The tasting fee is waived with a $50 purchase.  A diverse selection is available, but key varietals are Chardonnay and Pinot Noir.  My weekday visit was quiet. No crowding at the tasting bar, just as I prefer.  Adam was most helpful in choosing wines to taste.  I had already planned to purchase, and ended up with 3 bottles, 3 varietals.  I will return, and will seek out Au Bon Climat wines now that I am at home.  Highly recommended.

data.title: A Wine Lovers Must!
data.text:
Decided to pay a visit to Au Bon Climat wine tasting room as my company sells a range of their wines in the UK.
They have a very large selection of grape varieties which reflect the knowledge and passion of legendary winemaker Jim Clendenen.
There is helpful and passionate staff on hand to guide you through their range of wines and have a large selection available to taste.
The selection of grapes on hand really showcase Jim's experimental approach to wine making which is refreshing when there are so many producer's who are purely focused on profit.
With wines to suit all budgets this is a must for all wine lovers visiting California let alone Santa Barbara!

data.title: Top Class Winemaking
data.text: We were so lucky to find this little tasting room on the heart of SB near the mall and court house.  We purchased a 2006 Pinot Noir for our special dinner at Miro, Bacara Resort.  This tasting room offered Pinot Noir only flights, superb choice!

data.title: Great wines in a friendly setting!
data.text: Be sure to stop by this conveniently located tasting room in downtown Santa Barbara. The wines are excellent and Colin is a great host. He easily takes you through the tasting and will help you make a selection or two for take home!

data.title: Great wines/ Convenient location
data.text:
Since the winery does not have a retail outlet on premises, this tasting room makes it easy to obtain wines locally made by this extra special producer.  The wines are across the board high quality offering enjoyment early on and made to mature and last for many, many years.
The staff is well informed and can provide detailed information should one want to go there. The tasting format gives those inclined an added bonus to try wines not yet experienced and taste against others of the same varietal.
IMHO, this is the #1 winery in Santa Barbara County and one of the best in the US, let alone California.  If you agree, join their wine club and take advantage of special offers at special prices.

data.title: One of our favorites
data.text:
The wines and staff at ABC were exceptionally good. Owner-winemaker Jim Clendennen is one of the pioneers of the Santa Barbara area wine industry and continues to make great wines. We'd been walking around downtown Santa Barbara for hours and were more than a little tired when we walked into the tasting room. The staff graciously offered to let us sit at one of the tables usually reserved for private tastings and poured each of the wines in our flight at the table. 
As anticipated the wines were very good, and although the style is quite different from most of our Oregon pinot noirs, we found several of ABC's bottles to our liking.
We wound up buying a few of the 2009 "Isabelle" pinot after falling in love with the lush fruit, the structure and long finish. Definitely one to lay down for a few more years. Perhaps the best feature here is the wine library -- the walls are filled with several past vintages of quite a few of ABC's bottlings. Not only pinot noir, but chardonnay and other varietals are available going back 10 years or more. Perfect if you want to put together an instant vertical tasting without having to wait over a period of several years.
Most certainly a stop that any serious winelover should put on their itinerary when in the Santa Barbara area.

data.title: great wines, good staff.
data.text:
Mann, they make great wines. After the pinot noir tasting, I got an extra tasting of the white "Hildegard" wine. Although this was a real nice gesture from the guy behind the bar, it added to my problems. 

As I could only take 4 bottles back to Europe (already bought 2 at another winery) there were serious decisions to make. In the end I bought a bottle of "Hildegard" (astonishing wine) and one bottle of Pinot noir.

All in all, time very well spent!
